result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jason Shawn Twieg
Current: 218 N. Milwaukee Street, Fredonia, WI 53021 United States  (Effective: 08-26-2022)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

$100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.   
--Christopher D. Scholz, 1912 Madison Street, Two Rivers, WI  54241.

It is hereby ordered that the defendant's bond is modified from $750.00 cash to $100.00 cash.  There shall be an additional condition of absolute sobriety.  All other conditions are to remain the same.
Scheduling conference on November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order Modifying Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's bond is modified from $750.00 cash bond to $100.00 cash bond.  All other conditions are to remain the same.
AMENDED Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

3:25 pm - Defendant Jason Shawn Twieg appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Ann M. Larson appeared by video for Jason Shawn Twieg.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL- 
Attorney Larson moves to amend to recognizance bond.
State objects.
Court modified to $100.00 cash with all previous conditions remaining.  Court adds the condition of absolute sobriety.
Attorney Larson to draft order.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

RE:  2nd degree recklessly endangering safety/use of dangerous weapon-dvo, on 08-20-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-22-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of recklessly endangering safety, disorderly conduct and 2 counts felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-29-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $750.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Francis Kosobucki, Jr. or Amanda Schindler.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
